verbs.description: unanchor (third-person singular simple present unanchors, present participle unanchoring, simple past and past participle unanchored)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To raise an anchor or to free a vessel from an anchor.
(intransitive) To become loose or physically unattached.
(transitive, graphical user interface) To release from a fixed position and allow to be moved.
examples: To unanchor the cell cursor so that you can move it into position for selecting another range, press Shift+F8. This puts you in Add to Selection mode, in which you can move to the first cell of the next range without selecting any more cells.
